page.title: 20OIL, COAL: CROPWELL BUTLER
page.content:
Underground{coal mining}proceeds in the vicinity of Cropwell Butler which adjoins a large working mine at Cotgrave. There are coal reserves which may be worked in the future at Cropwell Butler.There is no open-cast mining. A seismic survey recently conducted in this area close to the Fosse Way revealed the presence of {oil.}The discovery was considered to be non-commercial but further surveys are planned. This is the first time, since on-shore oil was first produced in Britain in 1918, that oil has been located south of the Trent in the Midlands.
The work for this contribution to the {Domesday project}has been organised by Cropwell Butler & Tithby{Women's {Institute.}
